author: Sam Thompson

review: I have read a lot of reviews at other sites by users complaining about various things. I have only found a few video sources I cannot stream from my Mac laptop. Amazon Instant Video and PBS SO CAL are the only sources I could not get to work using the Chrome browser from my Mac. The image quality is not as good as a Roku but having the ability to throw almost any free or paid video source on my TV makes it well worth the $35. I can't play HBOGO on my Roku because Directv does not allow it.  But I can do it via the Chromecast. There is an amazing amount of free content you can stream to this thing. I also can stream local movie, music and photo files from my Mac using a 3rd party media server app via the Chrome bowser. I keep wondering if Google is going to cripple it sometime in the future. For now it works great.

review: Advertising says you can view your phone on your tv. Not quite. What they forget to mention is that the Internet you access on your phone via 3G or 4G cannot be cast to your tv. The only way chromecast works is when your phone is connected to a wireless signal that is connected to the Internet. Current advertising leads you to believe your phone communicates (casts) its Internet access to your tv, not true. There is no option for 3G (or higher) Internet access to be cast. Would have been a huge change if it could cast 3G or better service instead it's just another google hyped disappointment.
